question: 見送る
userAnswer: to{} see-off | escort | watch-_-go-out-of-sight | attend-funeral | let-_-pass/pass-up | postpone/put-off
activeAnswer: to{} see-off | escort | watch-_-go-out-of-sight | attend-funeral | let-_-pass/pass-up | postpone/put-off
sourceMnemonic: You know the words <ja>見る</ja> and <ja>送る</ja> by now, hopefully. Here you're "seeing" the "sending." You're seeing someone off, so this verb is <vocabulary>to see off</vocabulary>. This can also mean <vocabulary>to put off</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to pass on</vocabulary>, since it's as though you're just passively seeing someone (or something) off rather than taking action and going with them.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The readings come from the vocab words <ja>見る</ja> and <ja>送る</ja>. Make sure you know those and you'll know this word's reading as well.
